game

Class GameEnvironment

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.GameEnvironment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class GameEnvironment
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Game Environment controls the game.
    Version:
    1.0, 2.0 Adds variables and methods for loading / saving games
    Author:
    Manu, Jessee
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public void saveState()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the state of the game in a particular location.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If something went wrong.

      • loadState

        public static GameEnvironment loadState()
                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Loads the game state from a predetermined folder on the filesystem
        Returns:
        A new Game Environment.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When the serialized data could not be read.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - When a class hasn't been marked as Serializable.

      • getSaveStates

        public static java.io.File[] getSaveStates()
        Gets an array of file objects found in the save directory.
        Returns:
        An array of Files.

      • doesSaveStateExist

        public static boolean doesSaveStateExist()
        Gets whether or not any save states exist.
        Returns:
        True if at least one save state exists. False otherwise.

      • getTimeSaved

        public long getTimeSaved()
        Gets the time when the game was saved.
        Returns:
        The time in (milliseconds since the epoch) when the game was saved.

      • getIgnoreRoomPrompt

        public boolean getIgnoreRoomPrompt()
        Gets whether the game should ignore the room prompt. This is set to true internally when the game is loaded. This is to fix a very specific edge case where the player saves the game from within a Villain's Lair. Also sets the internal flag to false for subsequent calls.
        Returns:
        True if the game should ignore the room prompt. False otherwise.

      • getNumberOfSeconds

        public long getNumberOfSeconds()
        Returns:
        The number of seconds since the game began.
